H0.text: Plates are the dozen major and several minor divisions into which the lithosphere is divided.

H1.text: Zones are the divisions into which the lithosphere is divided, consisting of a dozen major and several minor zones.

H2.text: Crystals are the dozen major and several minor divisions into which the lithosphere is divided.

H3.text: Faults are the dozen major and several minor divisions into which the lithosphere is divided.

A4.text: Depending on how they are defined, there are usually seven or eight 'major' plates and many minor plates or 'platelets'.

A5.text: The key principle of plate tectonics is that the lithosphere exists as separate and distinct tectonic plates, which ride on the viscoelastic asthenosphere.
